alert.note: Alert for Caddo; Canadian (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 07 at 6:17AM CDT until June 07 at 9:15AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: The National Weather Service in Norman has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Southwestern Canadian County in central Oklahoma... Northeastern Caddo County in southwestern Oklahoma... * Until 915 AM CDT. * At 617 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Binger, Lookeba and Cedar Lake. This includes the following highways... Interstate 40 between mile markers 104 and 105. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
